thread.title: These completely black tattoos are giving off major artsy goth vibes
thread.title_full: These completely black tattoos are giving off major artsy goth vibes

author: Rachel Charlene Lewis
title: These completely black tattoos are giving off major artsy goth vibes
text:
These completely black tattoos are giving off major artsy goth vibes You probably already know that we dig blackwork tattoos , aka, tattoos that only use black ink. Nothing against color tattoos ( we love color tattoos, too !), but there’s something especially stunning about black tattoos. And they go with everything! But these tattoos are *completely* black, and they’re seriously blowing our minds.
Created by tattoo artist @slumdog.tattooer, aka Slumdog, these black tattoos are truly like nothing we’ve ever seen before. They mostly create nature-inspired tattoos, like twists on traditional rose tattoos, and traditional tattoos of gorgeous pinups , but with a gothic spin.
If artsy, goth vibes are what you’re going for, these black tattoos are about to be your new favorite thing. A photo posted by |SLUMDOG| (@slumdog.tattooer) on Jan 14, 2017 at 10:36am PST 
Mind you, they’re not for the faint of heart. We can only imagine how long some of these take! A photo posted by |SLUMDOG| (@slumdog.tattooer) on Jan 17, 2017 at 7:24am PST 
We probably wouldn’t recommend one of these for your first tattoo, but seasoned tattoo-lovers may be ready to take on of these on. A photo posted by |SLUMDOG| (@slumdog.tattooer) on Jan 13, 2017 at 11:33am PST 
Either way, they’re stunning as heck, and you’ll feel like a true work of art. A photo posted by |SLUMDOG| (@slumdog.tattooer) on Jan 12, 2017 at 12:54pm PST 
What makes these different from blackwork tattoos is the amount of ink used. They’re seriously filled in. A photo posted by |SLUMDOG| (@slumdog.tattooer) on Jan 16, 2017 at 12:19pm PST 
Much of Slumdog’s designs are stunning, retro ladies. We dig it! A photo posted by |SLUMDOG| (@slumdog.tattooer) on Jan 13, 2017 at 9:02am PST 
Roses are also a popular design. We’re loving this twist on the traditional rose tattoo. A photo posted by |SLUMDOG| (@slumdog.tattooer) on Jan 3, 2017 at 6:07am PST 
Are you gonna give one of these a shot? We’re definitely considering it!
